title.hi: An Inventory of Dr. Swift's Goods, upon lending his House to the

titleStmt.title: Bishop of M────, (not printed in his Works.)

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: X44-#2ZA 1 An oaken broken elbow-chair X44-#2ZA 2 A caudle cup without an ear;X44-#2ZA 3 A battered, shattered ash bedstead;X44-#2ZA 4 A box of deal without a lid;X44-#2ZA 5 A pair of tongs, but out of joint;X44-#2ZA 6 A poor old poker without a point;X44-#2ZA 7 A pot that's crack'd, aroundX44-#2ZA 8 With an old garter bound;X44-#2ZA 9 An iron lock without a key;X44-#2ZA 10 A wig with hanging quite grown grey;X44-#2ZA 11 X44-#2ZA 12 X44-#2ZA 13 X44-#2ZA 14 X44-#2ZA 15 A pair of bellows without a pipe;X44-#2ZA 16 A curtain worn to half a stripe;X44-#2ZA 17 A dish which might good meat have held once;X44-#2ZA 18 An Ovid and an old Concordance;X44-#2ZA 19 A bottle bottom, wooden platter,X44-#2ZA 20 One for meal, and one for water;X44-#2ZA 21 There is, besides, a copper skellet,X44-#2ZA 22 Which runs as fast as you can fill it;X44-#2ZA 23 A candlestick, a pan, a save-all,X44-#2ZA 24 And this his household you have all.X44-#2ZA 25 These to his Lordship as a friend,X44-#2ZA 26 Till he has built I'd recommeud;X44-#2ZA 27 They'd serve his Lordship for a shiftX44-#2ZA 28 Why not as well as Doctor Swift?X44-#2ZA
